data.title: The Ships that Never Sailed
data.meta_description:
@JonasResende: you know who Marie Christine was likely not interested in women?
@chateauroux and @The_Most_Happy: unluckily for your plan France wanted...
data.text:
Actually, Maria Karolina was intended for Louis XVI until the death of her older sister Maria Josefa. Maria Karolina married Maria Josefa's betrothed, Ferdinand of Naples and Sicily, to keep the Spanish alliance and Marie Antoinette was then betrothed to Louis XVI to keep the French alliance.

That is just a legend... The Archduchess offered to Paris was always Antonia, who was by long the most beautiful of the younger daughters and also the most age appropriate for the Dauphin.

OTL Maria Theresia after Josepha’s death offered to Charles III of Spain the choice between her remaining available daughters aka Maria Amelia and Maria Karolina as new bride for the King of Naples.

If Karolina was intended for Versailles she would not be offered as choice for the King of Naples (and likely Antonia would have)... likely Karolina and Amalia had not yet a match ready for them at the time of Josepha’s death while Antonia was already offered in France...

France had the priority over Naples so the Archduchess who was offered to Paris would have been reserved for them.

Plus I have read many books about Maria Theresia, Marie Antoinette and Maria Karolina and in none of them I have read a reference to the supposition who Antonia was not the first choice for the French match (at least with the Dauphin, because a match between Archduchess Elisabeth, the other beauty of the family (at least before the smallpox) and Louis XV and a match between one of the Mesdames and Joseph II were also suggested)

Playing the game (and my list is long):

Empress Maud and Stephen of Blois (a pity he was already married to another Matilde)

Richard I of England and Alais of France (if only his father had let them marry at the right time)

Arthur of Brittany and Marie of France

Louis VIII of France and Eleanor of Brittany

Nicholas of Anjou and Mary of Burgundy

Louis XI and Mary of Burgundy

Maximilian of Austria and Elizabeth of York

Nicholas of Anjou and Anne de Beaujeu

Charles VIII and Elizabeth of York

Charles VIII and Catherine of Navarre

James IV of Scotland and Cecily of York

Richard III and Elizabeth of York (but in a situation very different from OTL)

Edward V of England and Juana of Castile

Richard of Shrewsbury and Anne of Brittany

Manuel of Portugal and Juana of Castile

Jean d’Albret and Anne of Brittany

Edward V of England and Anne of Brittany

Ludovico Sforza and Isabella d’Este (I absolutely ship Ludovico with his OTL wife Beatrice but still would be fun seeing Isabella in Milan)

Henry VIII and Eleanor of Austria

John III of Portugal and Eleanor of Austria

Ferdinand of Austria and Isabella of Portugal (possible only if he was recognized heir of Spain)

Henry Percy and Anne Boleyn

Henry VIII and Margaret of Angoulême (need circumstances different from OTL for working)

Francis I and Mary Tudor (his OTL stepmother-in-law)

James V of Scotland and Mary I of England

Francesco II Sforza and Bona Sforza

Edward VI of England and Mary I of Scotland

Edward VI of England and Elisabeth of France

Edward VI of England and Jane Grey

Robert Dudley and Elizabeth I of England

Philip II of Spain and Mary I of Scotland

Don Carlos of Spain and Elisabeth of France

Ferdinand II of Austria and Elizabeth Stuart of England (would be so fun)

Charles II of England and Anne Marie Louise of Orléans

Philip IV of Spain and Anne Marie Louise of Orléans

Ferdinand III of Austria and Maria Eugenia or Isabella Maria Theresa of Spain

Ferdinand IV of Austria and Maria Theresa of Spain

Balthasar Carlos of Spain and Mariana of Austria

Leopold I of Austria and Marguerite of Orléans

Louis XIV of France and Henriette Anne of England

James II of England and Claudia Felicitas of Austria-Tyrol

William III of Orange and Elizabeth Charlotte of Palatinate

Peter II of Portugal and Anne of York

Charles VI of Austria and Elizabeth Farnese

Frederick the a Great of Prussia and Maria Theresa of Austria

Charles III of Spain and Maria Anna of Austria

Louis XV of France and Mariana Victoria of Spain

Louis XV of France and Marie Elisabeth of Austria

Louis, Duke of Bourgogne (Louis XVI’s older brother) and Marie Antoinette of Austria

Karl of Zweibrücken and Maria Amalia of Austria (really the fact who Christine was able to make a much worse match is really injust)

Ferdinand IV of Naples and Maria Josepha of Austria

Karl of Austria-Teschen and Maria Ludovica of Austria-Este

Louis XVII of France and Maria Antonia of Naples

Karl of Austria-Teschen and Marie Therese Charlotte of France

Louis Philippe of Orléans (OTL King of the French) and Marie Therese Charlotte of France

Fredrick, Prince of Wales and Lady Diana Spencer

Napoleon Bonaparte and Catherine of Russia

Louis Bonaparte and Maria Luisa of Spain (Dowager Queen of Etruria)

Eugene de Beauharnais and Maria Amelia of Naples

Ferdinand III of Tuscany and Hortense de Beauharnais

Ferdinand VII of Spain and Hortense de Beauharnais

Franz Joseph of Austria and Duchess Helene in Bavaria

Franz Joseph of Austria and Anne of Prussia

Maximilian of Austria (OTL Emperor of Mexico) and Duchess Elisabeth in Bavaria

Ludwig II of Bavaria and Duchess Sophie Charlotte in Bavaria

Rudolf of Austria and anyone but Stephanie of Belgium

Wilhelm I of Prussia and Elisa Radziwill

Albert Victor, Duke of Clarence and Helene of Orléans

Albert Victor, Duke of Clarence and Victoria Mary of Teck

George V of England and Alix of Hesse

William Cavendish, Marquess of Hartington and Princess Elizabeth of the United Kingdom

Peter Townsend and Princess Margaret of United Kingdom

John Fitzgerald Kennedy and Grace Kelly

Couples who were married in OTL but I still consider failed ships

James V of Scotland and Madeleine of France (deserved a much longer wedding)

Louis XII of France (as Duke of Orléans) and Anne of Brittany (as first wedding for her)

Maximilian of Austria and Anne of Brittany (they were married only in name)

Francis I of France and Eleanor of Austria (as first wedding for both or at least for her, not the OTL disaster)

Edward Seymour and Katherine Grey

Franz Ferdinand of Austria and Duchess Sophie Choteck (they deserved to have a full wedding)

William Cavendish, Marquess of Hartington and Kathleen Kennedy (their story is a true tragedy)
